fr.sii.ogham.core.builder

Class TemplateBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sii.ogham.core.builder.TemplateBuilder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Builder<TemplateParser>, TemplateParserBuilder

    public class TemplateBuilder
extends Object
implements TemplateParserBuilder
    A specialized builder for template management. It helps construct the template engines. By default, the builder construct the following engines:
    • ThymeleafParser (delegate construction to ThymeleafBuilder)
    By default, the builder will use the following template resolvers:
    • Resolver that is able to handle classpath resolution ( ClassPathResolver)
    • Resolver that is able to handle file resolution ( FileResolver)
    • Resolver that is able to handle string directly ( StringResourceResolver)
    This builder is also able to register a prefix and a suffix for template resolution. The aim is to be able to provide only the name of the template without needing to provide the full path to it.
    Author:
    Aur√©lien Baudet

        public TemplateBuilder()

    • Method Detail

      • useDefaults

        public TemplateBuilder useDefaults()
        Tells the builder to use all default behaviors and values. It will enable the following template engines:
        • ThymeleafParser with the associated detector ( ThymeleafTemplateDetector) by calling withThymeleaf()
        It will also use the default template resolvers:
        • Resolver that is able to handle classpath resolution ( ClassPathResolver)
        • Resolver that is able to handle file resolution ( FileResolver)
        • Resolver that is able to handle string directly ( StringResourceResolver)
        If the system properties provide values for prefix ( ogham.template.prefix) and suffix (ogham.template.suffix), then the builder will use them. If no value defined for these properties, then empty strings will be used.
        Returns:
        this builder instance for fluent use

      • useDefaults

        public TemplateBuilder useDefaults(Properties properties)
        Tells the builder to use all default behaviors and values. It will enable the following template engines:
        • ThymeleafParser with the associated detector ( ThymeleafTemplateDetector)
        It will also use the default template resolvers (by calling useDefaultResolvers()):
        • Resolver that is able to handle classpath resolution ( ClassPathResolver)
        • Resolver that is able to handle file resolution ( FileResolver)
        • Resolver that is able to handle string directly ( StringResourceResolver)
        If the provided properties provide values for prefix ( ogham.template.prefix) and suffix (ogham.template.suffix), then the builder will use them. If no value defined for these properties, then empty strings will be used.
        Parameters:
        properties - indicate which properties to use instead of using the system ones
        Returns:
        this builder instance for fluent use

      • registerTemplateParser

        public TemplateBuilder registerTemplateParser(TemplateParserBuilder builder)
        Register a specialized builder for a particular template engine. Using this method will associate a detector to this engine that will accept all templates.
        Parameters:
        builder - the builder to register
        Returns:
        this builder instance for fluent use

      • registerTemplateParser

        public TemplateBuilder registerTemplateParser(TemplateParserBuilder builder,
                                              TemplateEngineDetector detector)
        Register a specialized builder for a particular template engine. It also registers the associated detector to indicate if the engine can handle the templates at runtime.
        Parameters:
        builder - the builder to register
        detector - the detector that indicates if the engine can handle the provided template at runtime
        Returns:
        this builder instance for fluent use

      • useDefaultResolvers

        public TemplateBuilder useDefaultResolvers()
        Tells the builder to use the default template resolvers:
        • Resolver that is able to handle classpath resolution ( ClassPathResolver). The lookup prefix is "classpath:"
        • Resolver that is able to handle file resolution ( FileResolver). The lookup is "file:"
        • Resolver that is able to handle string directly ( StringResourceResolver). The lookup is "string:"
        • Default resolver if no lookup is used ( ClassPathResolver)
        This method is automatically called by useDefaults() or useDefaults(Properties).
        Returns:
        this builder instance for fluent use
        See Also:
        LookupMappingResourceResolverBuilder

      • withResourceResolverBuilder

        public TemplateBuilder withResourceResolverBuilder(LookupMappingResourceResolverBuilder resolverBuilder)
        Tells the builder to use your own builder for template resolution.
        Parameters:
        resolverBuilder - the builder to use instead of default one
        Returns:
        this builder instance for fluent use

      • withPrefix

        public TemplateBuilder withPrefix(String prefix)
        Description copied from interface: TemplateParserBuilder
        Set the prefix for template lookup. This prefix is used for all lookup methods. The aim is to define only the name of the template (or a subset) and the system will find it for you. It avoids to explicitly write the whole path and let you change the lookup method easily. For example:
        • You have one template located into /foo/template/createAccount.html
        • You have one template located into /foo/template/resetPassword.html
        So you can set the prefix to /foo/template/ and then reference the templates using the file name:
        • createAccount.html
        • resetPassword.html
        Specified by:
        withPrefix in interface TemplateParserBuilder
        Parameters:
        prefix - the prefix for template resolution
        Returns:
        The current builder for fluent use

      • withSuffix

        public TemplateBuilder withSuffix(String suffix)
        Description copied from interface: TemplateParserBuilder
        Set the suffix for template lookup. This suffix is used for all lookup methods. The aim is to define only the name of the template (or a subset) and the system will find it for you. It avoids to explicitly write the whole path and let you change the lookup method easily. For example:
        • You have one template located into /foo/template/createAccount.html
        • You have one template located into /foo/template/resetPassword.html
        So you can set the prefix to /foo/template/, the suffix to .html and then reference the templates using the file name:
        • createAccount
        • resetPassword
        Specified by:
        withSuffix in interface TemplateParserBuilder
        Parameters:
        suffix - the suffix for template resolution
        Returns:
        The current builder for fluent use

      • withLookupResolver

        public TemplateBuilder withLookupResolver(String lookup,
                                          ResourceResolver resolver)
        Description copied from interface: TemplateParserBuilder
        Register a lookup resolver. The lookup is like JNDI lookup. It indicates using a simple string how to handle the provided path or URL. For example:
        • "classpath:/foo" indicates that the provided path represents a classpath entry.
        • "file:/tmp" indicates that the provided path represents a file located on the system.
        Specified by:
        withLookupResolver in interface TemplateParserBuilder
        Parameters:
        lookup - the lookup name (without the : character)
        resolver - the resolver implementation
        Returns:
        The current builder for fluent use

      • withThymeleaf

        public TemplateBuilder withThymeleaf()
        Enable Thymeleaf template engine. This engine is used only if the associated detector (ThymeleafTemplateDetector) indicates that Thymeleaf is able to handle the provided template.
        Returns:
        this builder instance for fluent use

      • setPrefixKey

        public TemplateBuilder setPrefixKey(String prefixKey)
        Change the default property key for template resolution prefix. By default, the property key is ogham.template.prefix (see TemplateConstants.PREFIX_PROPERTY). Use this method to change the key.
        Parameters:
        prefixKey - the new property key for template resolution prefix
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent use

      • setSuffixKey

        Parameters:
        suffixKey - the new property key for template resolution prefix
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent use

      • build

        public TemplateParser build()
                     throws BuildException
        Build the template parser according to options previously enabled. If only one template engine has been activated then the parser will be this template engine parser. If there are several activated engines, then the builder will generate an AutoDetectTemplateParser. This kind of parser is able to detect which parser to use according to the provided template at runtime. The auto-detection is delegated to each defined TemplateEngineDetector associated with each engine. The builder will also construct a template resolver based on the previously defined mappings. This mapping is done using a LookupMappingResolver. It uses a map indexed by the lookup string (classpath, file, ...) and the resolver implementation as value. The builder will also provide the previously defined prefix and suffix to the resolvers and to the delegated builders.
        Specified by:
        build in interface Builder<TemplateParser>
        Returns:
        The parser implementation for templating system. If only one template engine defined, then use it directly. Otherwise use the auto-detection feature to automatically detect at runtime which engine to use
        Throws:
        BuildException - when the builder can't construct the parser

      • getParserBuilder

        public <B extends TemplateParserBuilder> B getParserBuilder(Class<B> clazz)
        Get reference to the specialized builder. It may be useful to fine tune the template engine.
        Type Parameters:
        B - the type of the class to get
        Parameters:
        clazz - the class of the parser builder to get
        Returns:
        the template parser builder instance
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - when provided class references an nonexistent builder

      • getThymeleafParser

        public ThymeleafBuilder getThymeleafParser()

        Get the reference to the specialized builder for Thymeleaf. It may be useful to fine tune Thymeleaf engine.

        Access this builder if you want to:
        • Use your own Thymeleaf template engine
        • Customize the lookup resolution for Thymeleaf
        • Customize the adapters
        Returns:
        The Thymeleaf builder

      • getResolverBuilder

        public LookupMappingResourceResolverBuilder getResolverBuilder()

        Get the builder used to handle resource resolution.

        Access this builder if you want to:
        • Customize how template resources are resolved
        • Register a custom lookup mapping resolver for template resources
        Returns:
        the builder used to handle resource resolution
